detaileddescription.para: Part of the mechanism that propogates namespaces through to serializer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &storage_type="memory", const std::string &storage_name="SemsimStore", const char *storage_options=nullptr, const char *model_options=nullptr)
memberdef.name: RDF

parameterdescription.para: Defaults to memory. Other options include: "hashes", "file", "mysql", "postgresql", "sqlite", "uri",
name used for storage. When storage is not internally held in memory, this becomes the name of the file or database.

options that get passed on to storage. Please study http://librdf.org/docs/api/redland-storage-modules.html for more information. @model_options options that get passed to the model. Please see http://librdf.org/docs/api/index.html for more details.

detaileddescription.para: RDF instances are not copyable due to restrictions within the redland libraries. You must instead move RDF objects.

briefdescription.para: copy assignment constructor for RDF ojects

detaileddescription.para: Copy assignment functionality is prohibited for RDF objects. Use move semantics insead.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of triples currently present in the RDF graph.
indicator for whether the RDF graph is empty

simplesect.para: true if RDF graph has no triples, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: non-static variant of RDF::fromString(). Reads rdf into an RDF instance. See RDF::fromString() for argument requirements.
non-static counterpart of RDF::fromUri. Downloads and parses rdf from a URI.
non-static counter part of RDF::fromFile. Reads rdf from annotations in a file

parameterdescription.para: the filename to read as string
the syntax of the RDF in filename

simplesect.para: an instantiated RDF object Uses LibrdfParser::fromFile under the hood

parameterdescription.para: the expected output syntax. Options include: "ntriples", "turtle", "rdfxml-xmp", "rdfxml-abbrev", "rdfxml", "dot", "json-triples", "json", "nquads", "html".

memberdef.name: toEditor

parameterdescription.para: the xml you want to open for editing. This can be any type of xml document, but SBML and CellML are most common.
When true, will add metaids onto a copy of the xml source code for annotation. Default = false.
an indicator enum specifying whether the xml is sbml, cellml or unknown. Default is "OMEXMETA_TYPE_NOTSET"

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &xml, bool generate_new_metaids=false, bool sbml_semantic_extraction=true) override
memberdef.name: toEditorPtr

briefdescription.para: compared namespaces seen with namespaces known and ensures models that use a known namespace use that namespace.

parameterdescription.para: a vector of strings of namespaces the parser has seen before.

detaileddescription.para: when the rdf graph is sbml, it will return OMEXMETA_TYPE_SBML. When cellML it will return OMEXMETA_TYPE_CELLML. Otherwise it is OMEXMETA_TYPE_UNKNOWN.

briefdescription.para: set the xml type for the current graph.

detaileddescription.para: If you have been reading from an SBML you cannot then read from another syntax (such as cellml).

briefdescription.para: getter for repository uri which defaults to "http://omex-library.org/"
setter for the repository uri which defaults to "http://omex-library.org/".

the new name for archive uri attribute default to http://omex-library.org/NewOmex.omex/
string for new model uri. defaults to http://omex-library.org/NewOmex.omex/NewModel.xml
